meanings.definition: A brief evocative description, account, or episode.
meanings.sent1: She wrote beautiful vignettes about her travels, capturing the essence of each place in just a few words.
meanings.sent2: The book is filled with short vignettes that paint a vivid picture of life in the countryside.
meanings.sent3: In her vignettes, she humorously described the daily mishaps of her clumsy cat.
meanings.sent4: The vignettes of childhood memories in the storybook were like colorful snapshots frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: His vignettes of city life were so detailed that you could almost hear the bustling streets and smell the food stalls.

meanings.definition: A small illustration or portrait photograph which fades into its background without a definite border.
meanings.sent1: The artist included delicate vignettes of flowers in the corner of the painting.
meanings.sent2: The old photo album was filled with black and white vignettes of family members from generations past.
meanings.sent3: The vignette of the tree in the painting seemed to blend seamlessly into the forest background.
meanings.sent4: Her face in the vignette looked as if it was emerging from the misty background like a ghost.
meanings.sent5: The vignette of the castle was so skillfully done that it appeared to be a part of the landscape itself.
